Book it. Before the pandemic, I traveled a lot. I have never seen a place as spic and span as this completely mother-in-law unit attached to the main house. This is a standard of cleanliness that is a cut above. I don’t think of Merced --where I went to Junior College—as a romantic destination. Many will be there to visit family as I was or for something related to the University. This accommodation was absolutely perfect and completely self-contained. The appliances all look like they were delivered yesterday, so new are they. Although it was 96 degrees outside, the unit has central air and ceiling fans and I remained comfortably cool the entire time. It has its own private entrance which is easily accessed without the necessity of keys through a numeric key pad. Other reviewers have mentioned ambient sounds from the host family in the main house. No question. At times you will hear signs of life from next door including the indistinct voice of a child. If you are here for a honeymoon getaway, this may not be your cup of tea. However, when it counts —when it’s time to wind down for bed and throughout the night— this place is as quiet as a tomb. You are unlikely to find a more quiet place for when it counts. There is a delightful little park 60 seconds away and the entire neighborhood is a quiet and safe oasis. Single women traveling will especially appreciate this aspect. Although in a newer and non-central part of town, that, for me, we as desirable for its peace and tranquility. You will have a car and can quickly get anywhere in this small town you care to go. The hosts could not have been kinder or more responsive. Make sure you open the hallway closest as I did not until five minutes before I left. Brand new washer/dryer for you inside with enough soap etc for a single wash (so bring some laundry supplies with you). I am so glad that I chose this accommodation and am pleased that I in a small way supported a fine, working family rather than a distant corporation by staying in motel row. This felt more like a house than a hotel room as it is quite large.

It has a small outdoor area but it hasn’t been landscaped yet. We really liked being able to put our two cars inside the garage and to spread out on the large comfy couch to watch movies. A note to anyone with chemical sensitivities— the house smells like laundry detergent— it’s very evident as soon as you walk in. Ram was excellent to communicate with and very accommodating, which we really appreciated. All in all a great stay—just what we were looking for!
